page.title: 15Armed Forces
page.content: To the West of our area is the Otterburn and Redesdale Army Training Area. Its main use is for artillery exercises, but is also used by the infantry and for low flying aeroplane exercises.The Belgian Army often uses the Range and on other occasions, West Germans and Americans. Many types of military vehicles pass through Harbottle, often in convoy.In the main they are lorries and Land Rovers, but we also see tanks and scout cars. Helicopters are often used in exercises and pass over the village, sometimes carrying loads slung below them. Red flags are flown at the track and road entrances to the Range to warn of the danger when there is an exercise in progress.
